alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued March 22 at 3:38PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Taos Avalanche Center. The Taos Avalanche Center in Taos has issued a Backcountry Avalanche Warning. * WHAT...The avalanche danger will be high through Thursday as an additional 1-5 inches of snow is forecasted over the next 24 hours. * WHERE...Wheeler Peak Wilderness Area and Columbine Hondo Wilderness above 9000 feet. * WHEN...In effect through Thursday at 1700 MDT. * IMPACTS...Continued snow and winds will likely create widespread areas of unstable snow. Both human triggered and natural avalanches are likely. Stay off slopes steeper than 30 degrees. This warning does not apply to ski areas where avalanche hazard reduction measures are performed. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions exist. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Consult http://www.taosavalanchecenter.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
